trans-unit.source: Creating and managing elastic database jobs
trans-unit.target: Creating and managing elastic database jobs

trans-unit.source: Walk through creation and management of an elastic database job.
trans-unit.target: Walk through creation and management of an elastic database job.

trans-unit.source: Create and manage a SQL Database elastic jobs with Portal (preview)
trans-unit.target: Create and manage a SQL Database elastic jobs with Portal (preview)

trans-unit.source: Elastic Database jobs enables easily and reliable management of a group of databases, by simplifying the execution of administrative operations such as schema changes, credentials management, reference data updates, performance data collection or tenant (customer) telemetry collection.
trans-unit.target: Elastic Database jobs enables easily and reliable management of a group of databases, by simplifying the execution of administrative operations such as schema changes, credentials management, reference data updates, performance data collection or tenant (customer) telemetry collection.

trans-unit.source: Elastic Database jobs is currently available through the Azure portal and PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: Elastic Database jobs is currently available through the Azure portal and PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: However, the Azure portal surfaces reduced functionality limited to execution across all databases in an <link><linkText>Elastic Database pool (preview)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: However, the Azure portal surfaces reduced functionality limited to execution across all databases in an <link><linkText>Elastic Database pool (preview)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To access additional features and execution of scripts across a group of databases including a custom-defined collection or a shard set (created using <link><linkText>Elastic Database client library</linkText><title></title></link>, see <link><linkText>Creating and managing jobs using PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To access additional features and execution of scripts across a group of databases including a custom-defined collection or a shard set (created using <link><linkText>Elastic Database client library</linkText><title></title></link>, see <link><linkText>Creating and managing jobs using PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about jobs, see <link><linkText>Elastic Database jobs overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about jobs, see <link><linkText>Elastic Database jobs overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: For a free trial, see <link><linkText>Free one-month trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a free trial, see <link><linkText>Free one-month trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: An elastic database pool.
trans-unit.target: An elastic database pool.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>About Elastic database pools</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>About Elastic database pools</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Installation of elastic database job service components.
trans-unit.target: Installation of elastic database job service components.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Installing the elastic database job service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Installing the elastic database job service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Creating jobs
trans-unit.target: Creating jobs

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure portal, from an existing elastic database job pool, click Create job.
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure portal, from an existing elastic database job pool, click Create job.

trans-unit.source: Type in the username and password of the database administrator (created at installation of Jobs) for the jobs control database (metadata storage for jobs).
trans-unit.target: Type in the username and password of the database administrator (created at installation of Jobs) for the jobs control database (metadata storage for jobs).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Name the job, type or paste in code, and click Run</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Name the job, type or paste in code, and click Run</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create Job blade, type a name for the job.
trans-unit.target: In the Create Job blade, type a name for the job.

trans-unit.source: Type the user name and password to connect to the target databases with sufficient permissions for script execution to succeed.
trans-unit.target: Type the user name and password to connect to the target databases with sufficient permissions for script execution to succeed.

trans-unit.source: Paste or type in the T-SQL script.
trans-unit.target: Paste or type in the T-SQL script.

trans-unit.source: Click Save and then click Run.
trans-unit.target: Click Save and then click Run.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create jobs and run</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create jobs and run</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Run idempotent jobs
trans-unit.target: Run idempotent jobs

trans-unit.source: When you run a script against a set of databases, you must be sure that the script is idempotent.
trans-unit.target: When you run a script against a set of databases, you must be sure that the script is idempotent.

trans-unit.source: That is, the script must be able to run multiple times, even if it has failed before in an incomplete state.
trans-unit.target: That is, the script must be able to run multiple times, even if it has failed before in an incomplete state.

trans-unit.source: For example, when a script fails, the job will be automatically retried until it succeeds (within limits, as the retry logic will eventually cease the retrying).
trans-unit.target: For example, when a script fails, the job will be automatically retried until it succeeds (within limits, as the retry logic will eventually cease the retrying).

trans-unit.source: The way to do this is to use the an "IF EXISTS" clause and delete any found instance before creating a new object.
trans-unit.target: The way to do this is to use the an "IF EXISTS" clause and delete any found instance before creating a new object.

trans-unit.source: An example is shown here:
trans-unit.target: An example is shown here:

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, use an "IF NOT EXISTS" clause before creating a new instance:
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, use an "IF NOT EXISTS" clause before creating a new instance:

trans-unit.source: This script then updates the table created previously.
trans-unit.target: This script then updates the table created previously.

trans-unit.source: Checking job status
trans-unit.target: Checking job status

trans-unit.source: After a job has begun, you can check on its progress.
trans-unit.target: After a job has begun, you can check on its progress.

trans-unit.source: From the elastic database pool page, click Manage jobs.
trans-unit.target: From the elastic database pool page, click Manage jobs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click "Manage jobs"</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click "Manage jobs"</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on the name (a) of a job.
trans-unit.target: Click on the name (a) of a job.

trans-unit.source: The STATUS can be "Completed" or "Failed."
trans-unit.target: The STATUS can be "Completed" or "Failed."

trans-unit.source: The job's details appear (b) with its date and time of creation and running.
trans-unit.target: The job's details appear (b) with its date and time of creation and running.

trans-unit.source: The list (c) below the that shows the progress of the script against each database in the pool, giving its date and time details.
trans-unit.target: The list (c) below the that shows the progress of the script against each database in the pool, giving its date and time details.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Checking a finished job</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Checking a finished job</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Checking failed jobs
trans-unit.target: Checking failed jobs

trans-unit.source: If a job fails, a log of its execution can found.
trans-unit.target: If a job fails, a log of its execution can found.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of the failed job to see its details.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of the failed job to see its details.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Check a failed job</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Check a failed job</linkText>
